software.title: Software
software.libraryNotSupported: Software library is currently not supported on this host.

tooltips.statusHeader: Online hosts will respond to a live query. Offline hosts won't respond to a live query because they may be shut down, asleep, or not connected to the internet.
tooltips.mdmStatus: Settings can be updated remotely on hosts with MDM turned on. To filter by MDM status, head to the Dashboard page.
tooltips.mdmServerUrl: The MDM server that updates settings on the host. To filter by MDM server URL, head to the Dashboard page.
tooltips.publicIpAddress: The IP address the host uses to connect to Fleet.
tooltips.lastFetched: The last time the host reported vitals.
tooltips.lastSeen: The last time the host was online.
tooltips.pendingHost: This host was ordered using Apple Business Manager (ABM). You will see host vitals when it is enrolled in Fleet

empty.title: No hosts found
empty.description: No hosts match the current filters
empty.addFirst: Add your first host to get started

deleteHostModal.title: Delete host
deleteHostModal.description: This will remove the record of {{hostText}} and associated data such as unlock PINs and disk encryption keys.
deleteHostModal.manyHostsWarning: When deleting a large volume of hosts, it may take some time for this change to be reflected in the UI.
deleteHostModal.reappearWarning: macOS, Windows, or Linux hosts will re-appear unless Fleet's agent is uninstalled.
deleteHostModal.mobileWarning: iOS and iPadOS hosts will re-appear unless MDM is turned off. It may take up to an hour to re-appear.

runScriptBatchModal.title: Run script
runScriptBatchModal.noScripts: No scripts available for this team
runScriptBatchModal.runDescription: Run a script on {{count}} host, or schedule a script to run on targeted hosts in the future.
runScriptBatchModal.runDescription_plural: Run a script on {{count}} hosts, or schedule a script to run on targeted hosts in the future.
runScriptBatchModal.scheduleTooltip: Enter a date and time to schedule this script.
runScriptBatchModal.errorTooManyHosts: Could not run script: too many hosts targeted. Please try again with fewer hosts.

filterBlock.hostsAffectedByCve: Hosts affected by the specified CVE.
filterBlock.munkiIssueTooltip: Hosts that reported this Munki issue the last time Munki ran on each host.
filterBlock.lowDiskSpaceTooltip: Hosts that have {{gb}} GB or less disk space available.
filterBlock.mdmAutomatic: MDM was turned on automatically. IT admins can block end users from turning MDM off.
filterBlock.mdmManual: MDM was turned on manually. End users can turn MDM off.
filterBlock.mdmPending: Hosts ordered using Apple Business Manager (ABM). They will automatically enroll to Fleet and turn on MDM when they're unboxed.

about.title: About
about.enrollmentIdTooltip: Enrollment ID is a unique identifier for personal hosts. Personal (BYOD) devices don't report their serial numbers. The Enrollment ID changes with each enrollment.
about.publicIpTooltip: The IP address the host uses to connect to Fleet.

activity.title: Activity
activity.tooltip: Failure of one activity won't cancel other activities.

policies.title: Policies
policies.notSupported: Policies are not supported for this host
policies.interestedIos: Interested in detecting device health issues on iPhones?
policies.interestedIpados: Interested in detecting device health issues on iPads?
policies.interestedAndroid: Interested in detecting device health issues on Android hosts?
policies.noPoliciesDevice: No policies are checked on your device
policies.noPoliciesHost: No policies are checked for this host
policies.expectingPoliciesDevice: Expecting to see policies? Try selecting "Refetch" to ask your device to report new vitals.
policies.expectingPoliciesHost: Expecting to see policies? Try selecting "Refetch" to ask this host to report new vitals.

queries.title: Queries
queries.scheduledNotSupported: Scheduled queries are not supported for this host
queries.notSupported: Queries are not supported for this host
queries.interestedChromebooks: Interested in collecting data from your Chromebooks?
queries.noScheduledQueries: No queries are scheduled to run on this host
queries.expectingQueries: Expecting to see queries? Try selecting Refetch to ask this host to report fresh vitals.

localUserAccounts.title: Local user accounts
localUserAccounts.checkDocs: Check out the Fleet documentation for
localUserAccounts.searchPlaceholder: Search local user accounts by username
localUserAccounts.noMatchingUsers: No users match your search criteria
localUserAccounts.noUsersDetected: No users detected on this host
localUserAccounts.expectingUsers: Expecting to see users? Try again in a few seconds as the system catches up.

munkiIssues.title: Munki issues
munkiIssues.noIssuesInfo: The last time Munki ran on this host, no issues were reported.

banners.mdmOff: MDM is turned off for this host

banners.turnOnMdm: To enforce settings, OS updates, disk encryption, and more, ask the end user to follow the Turn on MDM instructions on their My device page.

diskEncryption.actionRequired: Disk encryption: Requires action from the end user. Ask the user to follow Disk encryption instructions on their My device page.
diskEncryption.macActionRequired: Disk encryption: Requires action from the end user. Ask the end user to log out of their device or restart it.
diskEncryption.linuxOffRequiresReinstall: Disk encryption: Disk encryption is off. Currently, to turn on full disk encryption, the end user has to re-install their operating system.

chrome.default: Fleet does not check for disk encryption on Chromebooks, as they are encrypted by default.

enabled.line1: The disk is encrypted. The user must enter their
enabled.line2: password when they start their computer.

disabled.line1: The disk might be encrypted, but FileVault is off. The
disabled.line2: disk can be accessed without entering a password.

enabled.line1: The disk is encrypted. If recently turned on,

summary.diskSpaceAndroidTooltip: Includes internal and removable storage (e.g. microSD card).
summary.osDoesNotMeetRequirement: Does not meet minimum version requirement.

lock.title: Lock host
lock.message: Are you sure you want to lock this host?
lock.warning: The user will be locked out of their device.
lock.description: Lock a host when it needs to be returned to your organization.
lock.descriptionIos: This will enable Lost Mode. It can only be unlocked through Fleet.
lock.generatePin: Fleet will generate a six-digit unlock PIN.
lock.successMessage: Locking host or will lock when it comes online.
lock.organizationNameNote: Instead of "Fleet", the message will show the Organization Name that you configured in Organization settings.

unlock.title: Unlock host
unlock.message: Enter the unlock PIN to unlock this host.
unlock.successMessage: Unlocking host or will unlock when it comes online.
unlock.pinDescription: When the host is returned, use the 6-digit PIN to unlock the host.
unlock.descriptionIos: This will disable Lost Mode. End users will be able to use the host.
unlock.confirmMessage: Are you sure you're ready to unlock

wipe.title: Wipe host
wipe.message: Are you sure you want to wipe this host?
wipe.warning: All data will be permanently deleted.
wipe.successMessage: Wiping host or will wipe when the host comes online.
wipe.description: All content will be erased on this host.

diskEncryptionKey.title: Disk encryption key
diskEncryptionKey.recoveryTextDarwin: Use this key to log in to the host if you forgot the password.
diskEncryptionKey.recoveryTextOther: Use this key to unlock the encrypted drive.

bootstrapPackage.title: Bootstrap package
bootstrapPackage.failedToInstall: failed to install with the following error:
bootstrapPackage.installedTooltip: The host acknowledged the MDM command to install bootstrap package.
bootstrapPackage.pendingTooltip: Bootstrap package is installing or will install when the host comes online.
bootstrapPackage.failedTooltip: The host failed to install bootstrap package. To view errors, select

cancelActivity.title: Cancel activity
cancelActivity.description: If the activity is happening on the host it will still complete. Results won't appear in Fleet.

successMessage.macosSuffix: The end user will be prompted to follow the instructions.

errorMessage.mobile: Couldn't turn off MDM. Please try again.

description.ios: iOS and iPadOS hosts must be online to turn off MDM. If the host is offline, it will turn off MDM when it comes online.
description.android: Android hosts must be online to turn off MDM. If the host is offline, it will turn off MDM when it comes online.
description.macos: macOS hosts will turn off MDM the next time they restart.

reenrollInstructions.iosManual: End users can turn on MDM by selecting Turn on MDM on their My device page.
reenrollInstructions.iosAccountDriven: End users can turn on MDM by enrolling their host using Fleet Desktop.
reenrollInstructions.iosAutomatic: Hosts automatically enrolled via Apple Business Manager (ABM) will automatically turn on MDM the next time the host restarts.
reenrollInstructions.android: End users can turn on MDM by selecting Turn on MDM on their My device page.
reenrollInstructions.macos: End users can turn on MDM by selecting Turn on MDM on their My device page.
